api_info.title: RCSB RESTful API
api_info.description:
Provides programmatic access to information and annotations stored in the Protein Data Bank.
Models are generated from JSON schema version: 1.53.0

/core/assembly/{entry_id}/{assembly_id}.summary: Get structural assembly description by ENTRY ID and ASSEMBLY ID.

/core/branched_entity/{entry_id}/{entity.summary: Get branched entity description by ENTRY ID and ENTITY ID.

/core/branched_entity_instance/{entry_id.summary: Get branched entity instance description by ENTRY ID and ASYM ID.

/core/chemcomp/{comp_id}.summary: Get chemical component (ligands, small molecules and monomers) by CCD ID.

/core/drugbank/{comp_id}.summary: Get DrugBank annotations (integrated from DrugBank resource) for a given chemical component (identified by CHEM COMP ID) .

/core/entry_groups/{group_id}.summary: Get a group object that aggregates all entries associated with the specified PDB Group Deposition ID

/core/group_provenance/{group_provenance.summary: Describes aggregation method used to create groups

/core/interface/{entry_id}/{assembly_id}.summary: Get pairwise polymeric interface description by ENTRY ID, ASSEMBLY ID and INTERFACE ID.

/core/nonpolymer_entity/{entry_id}/{enti.summary: Get non-polymer entity data by ENTRY ID and ENTITY ID.

/core/nonpolymer_entity_groups/{group_id.summary: Get a group object that aggregates all non-polymer entities associated with the specified Chemical Component ID

/core/nonpolymer_entity_instance/{entry_.summary: Get non-polymer entity instance description by ENTRY ID and ASYM ID (label_asym_id).

/core/polymer_entity/{entry_id}/{entity_.summary: Get polymer entity data by ENTRY ID and ENTITY ID.

/core/polymer_entity_groups/{group_id}.summary: Get a group object that aggregates all polymer entities associated with the specified UniProt ID or sequence cluster ID

/core/polymer_entity_instance/{entry_id}.summary: Get polymer entity instance (a.k.a chain) data by ENTRY ID and ASYM ID (label_asym_id).

/core/pubmed/{entry_id}.summary: Get PubMed annotations (data integrated from PubMed) for a given entry's primary citation.

/core/uniprot/{entry_id}/{entity_id}.summary: Get UniProt annotations for a given macromolecular entity (identified by ENTRY ID and ENTITY ID).

/holdings/current/ccd_ids.summary: Get the list of current CCD IDs.

/holdings/current/entry_ids.summary: Get the list of current entry IDs.

/holdings/current/prd_ids.summary: Get the list of current PRD IDs for BIRD entries.

/holdings/status/{entry_id}.summary: Get the status and status code of a structure.

/holdings/status.summary: Get the status and status code of a list of entry IDs.

/holdings/removed/{entry_id}.summary: Get the description of the structure that was removed from the PDB repository.

/holdings/removed/entry_ids.summary: Get the list of removed entry IDs.

/holdings/unreleased.summary: Get a list of unreleased structures with descriptions.

/holdings/unreleased/{entry_id}.summary: Get the description of unreleased structure that is being processed or on hold waiting for release.

/holdings/unreleased/entry_ids.summary: Get the list of unreleased entry IDs.

ClustersMembers.description: Subunits that belong to the cluster, identified by asym_id and optionally by assembly operator id(s).

field_descriptions.ClustersMembers: Subunits that belong to the cluster, identified by asym_id and optionally by assembly operator id(s).
field_descriptions.ClustersMembers.asym_id: Internal chain ID used in mmCIF files to uniquely identify structural elements in the asymmetric unit.

field_descriptions.CoreAssembly.rcsb_id:
A unique identifier for each object in this assembly container formed by
 a dash separated concatenation of entry and assembly identifiers.
field_descriptions.CoreAssembly.rcsb_struct_symmetry_proven: The title and version of software package used for symmetry calculations.

field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssembly.details:
A description of special aspects of the macromolecular assembly.

               In the PDB, 'representative helical assembly', 'complete point assembly',
	       'complete icosahedral assembly', 'software_defined_assembly', 'author_defined_assembly',
	       and 'author_and_software_defined_assembly' are considered "biologically relevant assemblies.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssembly.id:
The value of _pdbx_struct_assembly.id must uniquely identify a record in
 the PDBX_STRUCT_ASSEMBLY list.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssembly.method_details:
Provides details of the method used to determine or
 compute the assembly.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssembly.oligomeric_count: The number of polymer molecules in the assembly.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssembly.oligomeric_details: Provides the details of the oligomeric state of the assembly.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssembly.rcsb_candidate_assemb:
Candidate macromolecular assembly.

 Excludes the following cases classified in pdbx_struct_asembly.details:

 'crystal asymmetric unit', 'crystal asymmetric unit, crystal frame', 'helical asymmetric unit',
 'helical asymmetric unit, std helical frame','icosahedral 23 hexamer', 'icosahedral asymmetric unit',
 'icosahedral asymmetric unit, std point frame','icosahedral pentamer', 'pentasymmetron capsid unit',
 'point asymmetric unit', 'point asymmetric unit, std point frame','trisymmetron capsid unit',
  and 'deposited_coordinates'.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssembly.rcsb_details: A filtered description of the macromolecular assembly.

field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssemblyAuthEvidence.assembly_: This item references an assembly in pdbx_struct_assembly
field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssemblyAuthEvidence.details: Provides any additional information regarding the evidence of this assembly
field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssemblyAuthEvidence.experimen: Provides the experimental method to determine the state of this assembly
field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssemblyAuthEvidence.id: Identifies a unique record in pdbx_struct_assembly_auth_evidence.

field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssemblyGen.assembly_id:
This data item is a pointer to _pdbx_struct_assembly.id in the
 PDBX_STRUCT_ASSEMBLY category.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssemblyGen.asym_id_list:
This data item is a pointer to _struct_asym.id in
 the STRUCT_ASYM category.

 This item may be expressed as a comma separated list of identifiers.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssemblyGen.oper_expression:
Identifies the operation of collection of operations
 from category PDBX_STRUCT_OPER_LIST.

 Operation expressions may have the forms:

  (1)        the single operation 1
  (1,2,5)    the operations 1, 2, 5
  (1-4)      the operations 1,2,3 and 4
  (1,2)(3,4) the combinations of operations
             3 and 4 followed by 1 and 2 (i.e.
             the cartesian product of parenthetical
             groups applied from right to left)
field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssemblyGen.ordinal:
This data item is an ordinal index for the
 PDBX_STRUCT_ASSEMBLY category.

field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssemblyProp.assembly_id: The identifier for the assembly used in category PDBX_STRUCT_ASSEMBLY.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssemblyProp.biol_id: The identifier for the assembly used in category PDBX_STRUCT_ASSEMBLY.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssemblyProp.type: The property type for the assembly.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructAssemblyProp.value: The value of the assembly property.

field_descriptions.PdbxStructOperList.id:
This identifier code must uniquely identify a
 record in the PDBX_STRUCT_OPER_LIST list.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructOperList.matrix_1_1:
The [1][1] element of the 3x3 matrix component of the
 transformation operation.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructOperList.matrix_1_2:
The [1][2] element of the 3x3 matrix component of the
 transformation operation.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructOperList.matrix_1_3:
The [1][3] element of the 3x3 matrix component of the
 transformation operation.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructOperList.matrix_2_1:
The [2][1] element of the 3x3 matrix component of the
 transformation operation.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructOperList.matrix_2_2:
The [2][2] element of the 3x3 matrix component of the
 transformation operation.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructOperList.matrix_2_3:
The [2][3] element of the 3x3 matrix component of the
 transformation operation.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructOperList.matrix_3_1:
The [3][1] element of the 3x3 matrix component of the
 transformation operation.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructOperList.matrix_3_2:
The [3][2] element of the 3x3 matrix component of the
 transformation operation.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructOperList.matrix_3_3:
The [3][3] element of the 3x3 matrix component of the
 transformation operation.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructOperList.name: A descriptive name for the transformation operation.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructOperList.symmetry_operation: The symmetry operation corresponding to the transformation operation.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructOperList.type: A code to indicate the type of operator.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructOperList.vector_1:
The [1] element of the three-element vector component of the
 transformation operation.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructOperList.vector_2:
The [2] element of the three-element vector component of the
 transformation operation.
field_descriptions.PdbxStructOperList.vector_3:
The [3] element of the three-element vector component of the
 transformation operation.

field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyAnnotation.assignment_versio: Identifies the version of the annotation assignment.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyAnnotation.name: A name for the annotation.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyAnnotation.provenance_source: Code identifying the individual, organization or program that assigned the annotation.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyAnnotation.type: A type or category of the annotation.

field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyAnnotationAdditionalProperti: The value(s) of the additional property.

field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyContainerIdentifiers.interfa: List of binary interface Ids within the assembly (it points to interface id collection).
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyContainerIdentifiers.rcsb_id:
A unique identifier for each object in this assembly container formed by
 a dash separated concatenation of entry and assembly identifiers.

field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyFeature.assignment_version: Identifies the version of the feature assignment.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyFeature.name: A name for the feature.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyFeature.provenance_source: Code identifying the individual, organization or program that assigned the feature.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyFeature.type: A type or category of the feature.

The value(s) of the additional property.

field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyFeatureFeaturePositions.asym: An identifier of polymer chain (label_asym_id) corresponding to the feature assignment.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyFeatureFeaturePositions.beg_: An identifier for the monomer at which this segment of the feature begins.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyFeatureFeaturePositions.end_: An identifier for the monomer at which this segment of the feature ends.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyFeatureFeaturePositions.stru: Identifies the list of operations from the category pdbx_struct_oper_list. One item in array per operator applied. The order follows how operators are applied.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyFeatureFeaturePositions.valu: The value(s) of the feature over the monomer segment.

field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.atom_count: The assembly non-hydrogen atomic coordinate count.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.branched_atom_count: The assembly non-hydrogen branched entity atomic coordinate count.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.branched_entity_count: The number of distinct branched entities in the generated assembly.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.branched_entity_instanc:
The number of branched instances in the generated assembly data set.
 This is the total count of branched entity instances generated in the assembly coordinate data.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.deuterated_water_count: The assembly deuterated water molecule count.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.hydrogen_atom_count: The assembly hydrogen atomic coordinate count.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.modeled_polymer_monomer:
The number of modeled polymer monomers in the assembly coordinate data.
 This is the total count of monomers with reported coordinate data for all polymer
 entity instances in the generated assembly coordinate data.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.na_polymer_entity_types: Nucleic acid polymer entity type categories describing the generated assembly.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.nonpolymer_atom_count: The assembly non-hydrogen non-polymer entity atomic coordinate count.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.nonpolymer_entity_count: The number of distinct non-polymer entities in the generated assembly exclusive of solvent.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.nonpolymer_entity_insta:
The number of non-polymer instances in the generated assembly data set exclusive of solvent.
 This is the total count of non-polymer entity instances generated in the assembly coordinate data.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.num_heterologous_interf: Number of heterologous (both binding sites are different) interface entities
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.num_heteromeric_interfa: Number of heteromeric (both partners are different polymeric entities) interface entities
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.num_homomeric_interface: Number of homomeric (both partners are the same polymeric entity) interface entities
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.num_interface_entities: Number of polymer-polymer interface entities, grouping equivalent interfaces at the entity level (i.e. same entity_ids on either side, with similar but not identical binding sites)
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.num_interfaces: Number of geometrically equivalent (i.e. same asym_ids on either side) polymer-polymer interfaces in the assembly
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.num_isologous_interface: Number of isologous (both binding sites are same, i.e. interface is symmetric) interface entities
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.num_na_interface_entiti: Number of nucleic acid-nucleic acid interface entities
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.num_prot_na_interface_e: Number of protein-nucleic acid interface entities
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.polymer_atom_count: The assembly non-hydrogen polymer entity atomic coordinate count.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.polymer_composition: Categories describing the polymer entity composition for the generated assembly.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.polymer_entity_count: The number of distinct polymer entities in the generated assembly.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.polymer_entity_count_DN: The number of distinct DNA polymer entities in the generated assembly.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.polymer_entity_count_RN: The number of distinct RNA polymer entities in the generated assembly.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.polymer_entity_count_nu: The number of distinct nucleic acid polymer entities (DNA or RNA) in the generated assembly.
The number of distinct hybrid nucleic acid polymer entities in the generated assembly.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.polymer_entity_count_pr: The number of distinct protein polymer entities in the generated assembly.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.polymer_entity_instance:
The number of polymer instances in the generated assembly data set.
 This is the total count of polymer entity instances generated in the assembly coordinate data.

The number of DNA polymer instances in the generated assembly data set.
 This is the total count of DNA polymer entity instances generated in the assembly coordinate data.

The number of RNA polymer instances in the generated assembly data set.
 This is the total count of RNA polymer entity instances generated in the assembly coordinate data.

The number of nucleic acid polymer instances in the generated assembly data set.
 This is the total count of nucleic acid polymer entity instances generated in the assembly coordinate data.

The number of hybrid nucleic acide polymer instances in the generated assembly data set.
 This is the total count of hybrid nucleic acid polymer entity instances generated in the assembly coordinate data.

The number of protein polymer instances in the generated assembly data set.
 This is the total count of protein polymer entity instances generated in the assembly coordinate data.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.polymer_monomer_count:
The number of polymer monomers in sample entity instances comprising the assembly data set.
 This is the total count of monomers for all polymer entity instances
 in the generated assembly coordinate data.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.selected_polymer_entity: Selected polymer entity type categories describing the generated assembly.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.solvent_atom_count: The assembly non-hydrogen solvent atomic coordinate count.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.solvent_entity_count: The number of distinct solvent entities in the generated assembly.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.solvent_entity_instance:
The number of solvent instances in the generated assembly data set.
 This is the total count of solvent entity instances generated in the assembly coordinate data.
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.total_assembly_buried_s: Total buried surface area calculated as the sum of buried surface areas over all interfaces
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.total_number_interface_: Total number of interfacing residues in the assembly, calculated as the sum of interfacing residues over all interfaces
field_descriptions.RcsbAssemblyInfo.unmodeled_polymer_monom:
The number of unmodeled polymer monomers in the assembly coordinate data. This is
 the total count of monomers with unreported coordinate data for all polymer
 entity instances in the generated assembly coordinate data.

field_descriptions.RcsbLatestRevision.major_revision: The major version number of the latest revision.
field_descriptions.RcsbLatestRevision.minor_revision: The minor version number of the latest revision.
field_descriptions.RcsbLatestRevision.revision_date: The release date of the latest revision item.

field_descriptions.RcsbStructSymmetry.kind:
The granularity at which the symmetry calculation is performed. In 'Global Symmetry' all polymeric
 subunits in assembly are used. In 'Local Symmetry' only a subset of polymeric subunits is considered.
 In 'Pseudo Symmetry' the threshold for subunits similarity is relaxed.
field_descriptions.RcsbStructSymmetry.oligomeric_state:
Oligomeric state refers to a composition of polymeric subunits in quaternary structure.
 Quaternary structure may be composed either exclusively of several copies of identical subunits,
 in which case they are termed homo-oligomers, or alternatively by at least one copy of different
 subunits (hetero-oligomers). Quaternary structure composed of a single subunit is denoted as 'Monomer'.
field_descriptions.RcsbStructSymmetry.stoichiometry: Stoichiometry of a complex represents the quantitative description and composition of its subunits.
field_descriptions.RcsbStructSymmetry.symbol:
Symmetry symbol refers to point group or helical symmetry of identical polymeric subunits in Schoenflies notation.
 Contains point group symbol (e.g., C2, C5, D2, T, O, I) or H for helical symmetry.
field_descriptions.RcsbStructSymmetry.type:
Symmetry type refers to point group or helical symmetry of identical polymeric subunits.
 Contains point group types (e.g. Cyclic, Dihedral) or Helical for helical symmetry.
field_descriptions.RcsbStructSymmetry.rotation_axes: The orientation of the principal rotation (symmetry) axis.

field_descriptions.RcsbStructSymmetryClusters.members: Subunits that belong to the cluster, identified by asym_id and optionally by assembly operator id(s).
field_descriptions.RcsbStructSymmetryClusters.avg_rmsd: Average RMSD between members of a given cluster.

field_descriptions.RcsbStructSymmetryLineage.id: Automatically assigned ID to uniquely identify the symmetry term in the Protein Symmetry Browser.
field_descriptions.RcsbStructSymmetryLineage.name: A human-readable term describing protein symmetry.

RcsbStructSymmetryRotationAxes.description: The orientation of the principal rotation (symmetry) axis.

field_descriptions.RcsbStructSymmetryRotationAxes: The orientation of the principal rotation (symmetry) axis.
field_descriptions.RcsbStructSymmetryRotationAxes.order:
The number of times (order of rotation) that a subunit can be repeated by a rotation operation,
 being transformed into a new state indistinguishable from its starting state.

field_descriptions.CorePolymerEntity.rcsb_id:
A unique identifier for each object in this entity container formed by
 an underscore separated concatenation of entry and entity identifiers.
field_descriptions.CorePolymerEntity.rcsb_membrane_lineage_: Mpstruc keyword denotes original annotation, Homology keyword denotes annotation inferred by homology.

field_descriptions.EntityPoly.nstd_linkage:
A flag to indicate whether the polymer contains at least
 one monomer-to-monomer link different from that implied by
 _entity_poly.type.
field_descriptions.EntityPoly.nstd_monomer:
A flag to indicate whether the polymer contains at least
 one monomer that is not considered standard.
field_descriptions.EntityPoly.pdbx_seq_one_letter_code:
Sequence of protein or nucleic acid polymer in standard one-letter
               codes of amino acids or nucleotides. Non-standard amino
               acids/nucleotides are represented by their Chemical
               Component Dictionary (CCD) codes in
               parenthesis. Deoxynucleotides are represented by the
               specially-assigned 2-letter CCD codes in parenthesis,
               with 'D' prefix added to their ribonucleotide
               counterparts. For hybrid polymer, each residue is
               represented by the code of its individual type. A
               cyclic polymer is represented in linear sequence from
               the chosen start to end.

A for Alanine or Adenosine-5'-monophosphate
C for Cysteine or Cytidine-5'-monophosphate
D for Aspartic acid
E for Glutamic acid
F for Phenylalanine
G for Glycine or Guanosine-5'-monophosphate
H for Histidine
I for Isoleucine or Inosinic Acid
L for Leucine
K for Lysine
M for Methionine
N for Asparagine  or Unknown ribonucleotide
O for Pyrrolysine
P for Proline
Q for Glutamine
R for Arginine
S for Serine
T for Threonine
U for Selenocysteine or Uridine-5'-monophosphate
V for Valine
W for Tryptophan
Y for Tyrosine
(DA) for 2'-deoxyadenosine-5'-monophosphate
(DC) for 2'-deoxycytidine-5'-monophosphate
(DG) for 2'-deoxyguanosine-5'-monophosphate
(DT) for Thymidine-5'-monophosphate
(MSE) for Selenomethionine
(SEP) for Phosphoserine
(TPO) for Phosphothreonine
(PTR) for Phosphotyrosine
(PCA) for Pyroglutamic acid
(UNK) for Unknown amino acid
(ACE) for Acetylation cap
(NH2) for Amidation cap
field_descriptions.EntityPoly.pdbx_seq_one_letter_code_can:
Canonical sequence of protein or nucleic acid polymer in standard
               one-letter codes of amino acids or nucleotides,
               corresponding to the sequence in
               _entity_poly.pdbx_seq_one_letter_code. Non-standard
               amino acids/nucleotides are represented by the codes of
               their parents if parent is specified in
               _chem_comp.mon_nstd_parent_comp_id, or by letter 'X' if
               parent is not specified. Deoxynucleotides are
               represented by their canonical one-letter codes of A,
               C, G, or T.

               For modifications with several parent amino acids,
	       all corresponding parent amino acid codes will be listed
	       (ex. chromophores).
field_descriptions.EntityPoly.pdbx_sequence_evidence_code: Evidence for the assignment of the polymer sequence.
field_descriptions.EntityPoly.pdbx_strand_id: The PDB strand/chain id(s) corresponding to this polymer entity.
field_descriptions.EntityPoly.pdbx_target_identifier: For Structural Genomics entries, the sequence's target identifier registered at the TargetTrack database.
field_descriptions.EntityPoly.rcsb_artifact_monomer_count:
Number of regions in the sample sequence identified as expression tags, linkers, or
 cloning artifacts.
field_descriptions.EntityPoly.rcsb_conflict_count: Number of monomer conflicts relative to the reference sequence.
field_descriptions.EntityPoly.rcsb_deletion_count: Number of monomer deletions relative to the reference sequence.
field_descriptions.EntityPoly.rcsb_insertion_count: Number of monomer insertions relative to the reference sequence.
field_descriptions.EntityPoly.rcsb_mutation_count: Number of engineered mutations engineered in the sample sequence.
field_descriptions.EntityPoly.rcsb_non_std_monomer_count: Number of non-standard monomers in the sample sequence.
field_descriptions.EntityPoly.rcsb_non_std_monomers: Unique list of non-standard monomer chemical component identifiers in the sample sequence.
field_descriptions.EntityPoly.rcsb_prd_id: For polymer BIRD molecules the BIRD identifier for the entity.
field_descriptions.EntityPoly.rcsb_sample_sequence_length: The monomer length of the sample sequence.

field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.expression_system_id:
A unique identifier for the expression system. This
 should be extracted from a local list of expression
 systems.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.gene_src_common_name:
The common name of the natural organism from which the gene was
 obtained.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.gene_src_details:
A description of special aspects of the natural organism from
 which the gene was obtained.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.gene_src_genus:
The genus of the natural organism from which the gene was
 obtained.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.gene_src_species:
The species of the natural organism from which the gene was
 obtained.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.gene_src_strain:
The strain of the natural organism from which the gene was
 obtained, if relevant.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.gene_src_tissue:
The tissue of the natural organism from which the gene was
 obtained.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.gene_src_tissue_fraction:
The subcellular fraction of the tissue of the natural organism
 from which the gene was obtained.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.host_org_common_name:
The common name of the organism that served as host for the
 production of the entity.  Where full details of the protein
 production are available it would be expected that this item
 be derived from _entity_src_gen_express.host_org_common_name
 or via _entity_src_gen_express.host_org_tax_id
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.host_org_details:
A description of special aspects of the organism that served as
 host for the production of the entity. Where full details of
 the protein production are available it would be expected that
 this item would derived from _entity_src_gen_express.host_org_details
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.host_org_genus:
The genus of the organism that served as host for the production
 of the entity.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.host_org_species:
The species of the organism that served as host for the
 production of the entity.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_alt_source_flag:
This data item identifies cases in which an alternative source
 modeled.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_beg_seq_num:
The beginning polymer sequence position for the polymer section corresponding
 to this source.

 A reference to the sequence position in the entity_poly category.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_description: Information on the source which is not given elsewhere.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_end_seq_num:
The ending polymer sequence position for the polymer section corresponding
 to this source.

 A reference to the sequence position in the entity_poly category.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_gene_src_atcc: American Type Culture Collection tissue culture number.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_gene_src_cellular_loca: Identifies the location inside (or outside) the cell.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_gene_src_fragment: A domain or fragment of the molecule.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_gene_src_ncbi_taxonomy:
NCBI Taxonomy identifier for the gene source organism.

 Reference:

 Wheeler DL, Chappey C, Lash AE, Leipe DD, Madden TL, Schuler GD,
 Tatusova TA, Rapp BA (2000). Database resources of the National
 Center for Biotechnology Information. Nucleic Acids Res 2000 Jan
 1;28(1):10-4

 Benson DA, Karsch-Mizrachi I, Lipman DJ, Ostell J, Rapp BA,
 Wheeler DL (2000). GenBank. Nucleic Acids Res 2000 Jan 1;28(1):15-18.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_gene_src_organ: Organized group of tissues that carries on a specialized function.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_host_org_atcc:
Americal Tissue Culture Collection of the expression system. Where
 full details of the protein production are available it would
 be expected that this item  would be derived from
 _entity_src_gen_express.host_org_culture_collection
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_host_org_cell:
Cell type from which the gene is derived. Where
 entity.target_id is provided this should be derived from
 details of the target.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_host_org_cell_line:
A specific line of cells used as the expression system. Where
 full details of the protein production are available it would
 be expected that this item would be derived from
 entity_src_gen_express.host_org_cell_line
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_host_org_cellular_loca:
Identifies the location inside (or outside) the cell which
 expressed the molecule.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_host_org_culture_colle:
Culture collection of the expression system. Where
 full details of the protein production are available it would
 be expected that this item  would be derived somehwere, but
 exactly where is not clear.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_host_org_gene: Specific gene which expressed the molecule.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_host_org_ncbi_taxonomy:
NCBI Taxonomy identifier for the expression system organism.

 Reference:

 Wheeler DL, Chappey C, Lash AE, Leipe DD, Madden TL, Schuler GD,
 Tatusova TA, Rapp BA (2000). Database resources of the National
 Center for Biotechnology Information. Nucleic Acids Res 2000 Jan
 1;28(1):10-4

field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_host_org_organ: Specific organ which expressed the molecule.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_host_org_organelle: Specific organelle which expressed the molecule.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_host_org_scientific_na:
The scientific name of the organism that served as host for the
 production of the entity. Where full details of the protein
 production are available it would be expected that this item
 would be derived from _entity_src_gen_express.host_org_scientific_name
 or via _entity_src_gen_express.host_org_tax_id
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_host_org_strain:
The strain of the organism in which the entity was
expressed.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_host_org_tissue:
The specific tissue which expressed the molecule. Where full details
 of the protein production are available it would be expected that this
 item would be derived from _entity_src_gen_express.host_org_tissue
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_host_org_tissue_fracti:
The fraction of the tissue which expressed the
molecule.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_host_org_variant:
Variant of the organism used as the expression system. Where
 full details of the protein production are available it would
 be expected that this item be derived from
 entity_src_gen_express.host_org_variant or via
 _entity_src_gen_express.host_org_tax_id
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_host_org_vector:
Identifies the vector used. Where full details of the protein
 production are available it would be expected that this item
 would be derived from _entity_src_gen_clone.vector_name.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_host_org_vector_type:
Identifies the type of vector used (plasmid, virus, or cosmid).
 Where full details of the protein production are available it
 would be expected that this item would be derived from
 _entity_src_gen_express.vector_type.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_seq_type: This data item povides additional information about the sequence type.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.pdbx_src_id: This data item is an ordinal identifier for entity_src_gen data records.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.plasmid_details:
A description of special aspects of the plasmid that produced the
 entity in the host organism. Where full details of the protein
 production are available it would be expected that this item
 would be derived from _pdbx_construct.details of the construct
 pointed to from _entity_src_gen_express.plasmid_id.
field_descriptions.EntitySrcGen.plasmid_name:
The name of the plasmid that produced the entity in the host
 organism. Where full details of the protein production are available
 it would be expected that this item would be derived from
 _pdbx_construct.name of the construct pointed to from
 _entity_src_gen_express.plasmid_id.

field_descriptions.RcsbEntitySourceOrganism.ncbi_parent_sci:
A parent scientific name in the NCBI taxonomy hierarchy of the source organism assigned by the PDB depositor.
  For cellular organism this corresponds to a superkingdom (e.g., Archaea, Bacteria, Eukaryota).  For viruses this
  corresponds to a clade (e.g.  Adnaviria, Bicaudaviridae, Clavaviridae). For other and unclassified entries this
  corresponds to the first level of any taxonomic rank below the root level.

field_descriptions.ChemComp.formula:
The formula for the chemical component. Formulae are written
 according to the following rules:

 (1) Only recognized element symbols may be used.

 (2) Each element symbol is followed by a 'count' number. A count
    of '1' may be omitted.

 (3) A space or parenthesis must separate each cluster of
    (element symbol + count), but in general parentheses are
    not used.

 (4) The order of elements depends on whether carbon is
    present or not. If carbon is present, the order should be:
    C, then H, then the other elements in alphabetical order
    of their symbol. If carbon is not present, the elements
    are listed purely in alphabetic order of their symbol. This
    is the 'Hill' system used by Chemical Abstracts.
field_descriptions.ChemComp.formula_weight: Formula mass of the chemical component.
field_descriptions.ChemComp.id:
The value of _chem_comp.id must uniquely identify each item in
 the CHEM_COMP list.

 For protein polymer entities, this is the three-letter code for
 the amino acid.

 For nucleic acid polymer entities, this is the one-letter code
 for the base.
field_descriptions.ChemComp.mon_nstd_parent_comp_id:
The identifier for the parent component of the nonstandard
 component. May be be a comma separated list if this component
 is derived from multiple components.

 Items in this indirectly point to _chem_comp.id in
 the CHEM_COMP category.
field_descriptions.ChemComp.name: The full name of the component.
field_descriptions.ChemComp.one_letter_code:
For standard polymer components, the one-letter code for
 the component.   For non-standard polymer components, the
 one-letter code for parent component if this exists;
 otherwise, the one-letter code should be given as 'X'.

 Components that derived from multiple parents components
 are described by a sequence of one-letter-codes.
field_descriptions.ChemComp.pdbx_ambiguous_flag:
A preliminary classification used by PDB to indicate
 that the chemistry of this component while described
 as clearly as possible is still ambiguous.  Software
 tools may not be able to process this component
 definition.
field_descriptions.ChemComp.pdbx_formal_charge:
The net integer charge assigned to this component. This is the
 formal charge assignment normally found in chemical diagrams.
field_descriptions.ChemComp.pdbx_initial_date: Date component was added to database.
field_descriptions.ChemComp.pdbx_processing_site:
This data item identifies the deposition site that processed
 this chemical component defintion.
field_descriptions.ChemComp.pdbx_release_status: This data item holds the current release status for the component.
field_descriptions.ChemComp.pdbx_replaced_by:
Identifies the _chem_comp.id of the component that
 has replaced this component.
field_descriptions.ChemComp.pdbx_replaces:
Identifies the _chem_comp.id's of the components
 which have been replaced by this component.
 Multiple id codes should be separated by commas.
field_descriptions.ChemComp.pdbx_subcomponent_list: The list of subcomponents contained in this component.
field_descriptions.ChemComp.three_letter_code:
For standard polymer components, the common three-letter code for
 the component.   Non-standard polymer components and non-polymer
 components are also assigned three-letter-codes.

 For ambiguous polymer components three-letter code should
 be given as 'UNK'.  Ambiguous ions are assigned the code 'UNX'.
 Ambiguous non-polymer components are assigned the code 'UNL'.
field_descriptions.ChemComp.type:
For standard polymer components, the type of the monomer.
 Note that monomers that will form polymers are of three types:
 linking monomers, monomers with some type of N-terminal (or 5')
 cap and monomers with some type of C-terminal (or 3') cap.

field_descriptions.PdbxReferenceMolecule.chem_comp_id:
For entities represented as single molecules, the identifier
 corresponding to the chemical definition for the molecule.
field_descriptions.PdbxReferenceMolecule.class: Broadly defines the function of the entity.
field_descriptions.PdbxReferenceMolecule.formula:
The formula for the reference entity. Formulae are written
 according to the rules:

 1. Only recognised element symbols may be used.

 2. Each element symbol is followed by a 'count' number. A count
    of '1' may be omitted.

 3. A space or parenthesis must separate each element symbol and
    its count, but in general parentheses are not used.

 4. The order of elements depends on whether or not carbon is
    present. If carbon is present, the order should be: C, then
    H, then the other elements in alphabetical order of their
    symbol. If carbon is not present, the elements are listed
    purely in alphabetic order of their symbol. This is the
    'Hill' system used by Chemical Abstracts.
field_descriptions.PdbxReferenceMolecule.formula_weight: Formula mass in daltons of the entity.
field_descriptions.PdbxReferenceMolecule.name: A name of the entity.
field_descriptions.PdbxReferenceMolecule.prd_id:
The value of _pdbx_reference_molecule.prd_id is the unique identifier
 for the reference molecule in this family.

 By convention this ID uniquely identifies the reference molecule in
 in the PDB reference dictionary.

 The ID has the template form PRD_dddddd (e.g. PRD_000001)
field_descriptions.PdbxReferenceMolecule.release_status: Defines the current PDB release status for this molecule definition.
field_descriptions.PdbxReferenceMolecule.replaced_by: Assigns the identifier of the reference molecule that has replaced this molecule.
field_descriptions.PdbxReferenceMolecule.replaces:
Assigns the identifier for the reference molecule which have been replaced

 Multiple molecule identifier codes should be separated by commas.
field_descriptions.PdbxReferenceMolecule.represent_as: Defines how this entity is represented in PDB data files.
field_descriptions.PdbxReferenceMolecule.representative_PDB: The PDB accession code for the entry containing a representative example of this molecule.
field_descriptions.PdbxReferenceMolecule.type: Defines the structural classification of the entity.

field_descriptions.PdbxReferenceMoleculeRelatedStructures.f:
The value of _pdbx_reference_molecule_related_structures.family_prd_id is a reference to
 _pdbx_reference_molecule_list.family_prd_id in category PDBX_REFERENCE_MOLECULE_FAMILY_LIST.

The formula for the reference entity. Formulae are written
 according to the rules:

 1. Only recognised element symbols may be used.

 2. Each element symbol is followed by a 'count' number. A count
    of '1' may be omitted.

 3. A space or parenthesis must separate each element symbol and
    its count, but in general parentheses are not used.

 4. The order of elements depends on whether or not carbon is
    present. If carbon is present, the order should be: C, then
    H, then the other elements in alphabetical order of their
    symbol. If carbon is not present, the elements are listed
    purely in alphabetic order of their symbol. This is the
    'Hill' system used by Chemical Abstracts.

Unit-cell length a corresponding to the structure reported in
angstroms.
field_descriptions.Cell.length_b:
Unit-cell length b corresponding to the structure reported in
 angstroms.
field_descriptions.Cell.length_c:
Unit-cell length c corresponding to the structure reported in
angstroms.
field_descriptions.Cell.pdbx_unique_axis:
To further identify unique axis if necessary.  E.g., P 21 with

field_descriptions.Cell.volume:
Cell volume V in angstroms cubed.

 V = a b c (1 - cos^2^~alpha~ - cos^2^~beta~ - cos^2^~gamma~
            + 2 cos~alpha~ cos~beta~ cos~gamma~)^1/2^

 a     = _cell.length_a
 b     = _cell.length_b
 c     = _cell.length_c
 alpha = _cell.angle_alpha
 beta  = _cell.angle_beta
 gamma = _cell.angle_gamma

field_descriptions.Em2dCrystalEntity.c_sampling_length: Length used to sample the reciprocal lattice lines in the c-direction.
field_descriptions.Em2dCrystalEntity.image_processing_id: pointer to _em_image_processing.id in the EM_IMAGE_PROCESSING category.
field_descriptions.Em2dCrystalEntity.space_group_name_H_M:
There are 17 plane groups classified as oblique, rectangular, square, and hexagonal.
 To describe the symmetry of 2D crystals of biological molecules,
 plane groups are expanded to equivalent noncentrosymmetric space groups.
 The 2D crystal plane corresponds to the 'ab' plane of the space group.

 Enumerated space group descriptions include the plane group number in parentheses,
 the H-M plane group symbol, and the plane group class.

field_descriptions.Em3dCrystalEntity.image_processing_id: pointer to _em_image_processing.id in the EM_IMAGE_PROCESSING category.

field_descriptions.Em3dFitting.details:
Any additional details regarding fitting of atomic coordinates into
 the 3DEM volume, including data and considerations from other
 methods used in computation of the model.

 a fitting procedure of atomic coordinates
 into 3dem reconstructed map volume.
field_descriptions.Em3dFitting.method:

 into the 3dem reconstructed map.
field_descriptions.Em3dFitting.overall_b_value: The overall B (temperature factor) value for the 3d-em volume.
field_descriptions.Em3dFitting.ref_space:

field_descriptions.Em3dFitting.target_criteria:

 3DEM map volume.

 to  _em_3d_fitting.id in the 3d_fitting category
