only one chain can be specified per instance.  If all chains of a particular
structure have been used for fitting, this field can be left blank.
field_descriptions.Em3dFittingList.pdb_chain_residue_range: Residue range for the identified chain.
field_descriptions.Em3dFittingList.pdb_entry_id: The PDB code for the entry used in fitting.

field_descriptions.Em3dReconstruction.actual_pixel_size: The actual pixel size of the projection set of images in Angstroms.
field_descriptions.Em3dReconstruction.algorithm: The reconstruction algorithm/technique used to generate the map.
field_descriptions.Em3dReconstruction.details: Any additional details used in the 3d reconstruction.
field_descriptions.Em3dReconstruction.image_processing_id: Foreign key to the EM_IMAGE_PROCESSING category
field_descriptions.Em3dReconstruction.magnification_calibra: The magnification calibration method for the 3d reconstruction.
field_descriptions.Em3dReconstruction.method: The algorithm method used for the 3d-reconstruction.
field_descriptions.Em3dReconstruction.nominal_pixel_size: The nominal pixel size of the projection set of images in Angstroms.
field_descriptions.Em3dReconstruction.num_class_averages: The number of classes used in the final 3d reconstruction
field_descriptions.Em3dReconstruction.num_particles: The number of 2D projections or 3D subtomograms used in the 3d reconstruction
field_descriptions.Em3dReconstruction.refinement_type: Indicates details on how the half-map used for resolution determination (usually by FSC) have been generated.
field_descriptions.Em3dReconstruction.resolution: The final resolution (in angstroms) of the 3D reconstruction.
field_descriptions.Em3dReconstruction.resolution_method:
The  method used to determine the final resolution
 of the 3d reconstruction.
 The Fourier Shell Correlation criterion as a measure of
 resolution is based on the concept of splitting the (2D)
 data set into two halves; averaging each and comparing them
 using the Fourier Ring Correlation (FRC) technique.
field_descriptions.Em3dReconstruction.symmetry_type: The type of symmetry applied to the reconstruction

field_descriptions.EmCtfCorrection.details: Any additional details about CTF correction
field_descriptions.EmCtfCorrection.em_image_processing_id: Foreign key to the EM_IMAGE_PROCESSING category

field_descriptions.EmDiffraction.camera_length:
The camera length (in millimeters). The camera length is the
 product of the objective focal length and the combined magnification
 of the intermediate and projector lenses when the microscope is
 operated in the diffraction mode.
field_descriptions.EmDiffraction.imaging_id: Foreign key to the EM_IMAGING category
field_descriptions.EmDiffraction.tilt_angle_list: Comma-separated list of tilt angles (in degrees) used in the electron diffraction experiment.

field_descriptions.EmDiffractionShell.fourier_space_coverag: Completeness of the structure factor data within this resolution shell, in percent
field_descriptions.EmDiffractionShell.high_resolution: High resolution limit for this shell (angstroms)
field_descriptions.EmDiffractionShell.low_resolution: Low resolution limit for this shell (angstroms)
field_descriptions.EmDiffractionShell.multiplicity: Multiplicity (average number of measurements) for the structure factors in this resolution shell
field_descriptions.EmDiffractionShell.num_structure_factors: Number of measured structure factors in this resolution shell
field_descriptions.EmDiffractionShell.phase_residual: Phase residual for this resolution shell, in degrees

field_descriptions.EmDiffractionStats.details: Any addition details about the structure factor measurements
field_descriptions.EmDiffractionStats.fourier_space_coverag:
Completeness of the structure factor data within the defined space group
 at the reported resolution (percent).
field_descriptions.EmDiffractionStats.high_resolution: High resolution limit of the structure factor data, in angstroms
field_descriptions.EmDiffractionStats.num_intensities_measu: Total number of diffraction intensities measured (before averaging)
field_descriptions.EmDiffractionStats.num_structure_factors: Number of structure factors obtained (merged amplitudes + phases)

field_descriptions.EmEmbedding.details: Staining procedure used in the specimen preparation.
field_descriptions.EmEmbedding.specimen_id: Foreign key relationship to the EM SPECIMEN category

field_descriptions.EmEntityAssembly.details: Additional details about the sample or sample subcomponent.
field_descriptions.EmEntityAssembly.entity_id_list:
macromolecules associated with this component, if defined
 as comma separated list of entity ids (integers).
field_descriptions.EmEntityAssembly.name: The name of the sample or sample subcomponent.
field_descriptions.EmEntityAssembly.parent_id:
The parent of this assembly.
 This data item is an internal category pointer to _em_entity_assembly.id.
 By convention, the full assembly (top of hierarchy) is assigned parent id 0 (zero).
field_descriptions.EmEntityAssembly.source:
The type of source (e.g., natural source) for the component (sample or sample
subcomponent)
field_descriptions.EmEntityAssembly.type: The general type of the sample or sample subcomponent.

field_descriptions.EmExperiment.aggregation_state: The aggregation/assembly state of the imaged specimen.
field_descriptions.EmExperiment.entity_assembly_id: Foreign key to the EM_ENTITY_ASSEMBLY category
field_descriptions.EmExperiment.reconstruction_method: The reconstruction method used in the EM experiment.

field_descriptions.EmHelicalEntity.angular_rotation_per_sub: The angular rotation per helical subunit in degrees. Negative values indicate left-handed helices; positive values indicate right handed helices.
field_descriptions.EmHelicalEntity.axial_rise_per_subunit: The axial rise per subunit in the helical assembly.
field_descriptions.EmHelicalEntity.axial_symmetry: Symmetry of the helical axis, either cyclic (Cn) or dihedral (Dn), where n>=1.
field_descriptions.EmHelicalEntity.details: Any other details regarding the helical assembly
field_descriptions.EmHelicalEntity.image_processing_id: This data item is a pointer to _em_image_processing.id.

field_descriptions.EmImageRecording.average_exposure_time: The average exposure time for each image.
field_descriptions.EmImageRecording.avg_electron_dose_per_i: The electron dose received by the specimen per image (electrons per square angstrom).
field_descriptions.EmImageRecording.details: Any additional details about image recording.
field_descriptions.EmImageRecording.detector_mode: The detector mode used during image recording.
field_descriptions.EmImageRecording.film_or_detector_model:
The detector type used for recording images.
 Usually film , CCD camera or direct electron detector.
field_descriptions.EmImageRecording.imaging_id: This data item the id of the microscopy settings used in the imaging.
field_descriptions.EmImageRecording.num_diffraction_images: The number of diffraction images collected.
field_descriptions.EmImageRecording.num_grids_imaged: Number of grids in the microscopy session
field_descriptions.EmImageRecording.num_real_images: The number of micrograph images collected.

field_descriptions.EmImaging.accelerating_voltage: A value of accelerating voltage (in kV) used for imaging.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.alignment_procedure: The type of procedure used to align the microscope electron beam.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.c2_aperture_diameter:
The open diameter of the c2 condenser lens,
 in microns.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.calibrated_defocus_max:
The maximum calibrated defocus value of the objective lens (in nanometers) used
 to obtain the recorded images. Negative values refer to overfocus.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.calibrated_defocus_min:
The minimum calibrated defocus value of the objective lens (in nanometers) used
 to obtain the recorded images. Negative values refer to overfocus.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.calibrated_magnification:
The magnification value obtained for a known standard just
 prior to, during or just after the imaging experiment.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.cryogen:
Cryogen type used to maintain the specimen stage temperature during imaging
 in the microscope.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.date:
Date (YYYY-MM-DD) of imaging experiment or the date at which
 a series of experiments began.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.detector_distance:
The camera length (in millimeters). The camera length is the
 product of the objective focal length and the combined magnification
 of the intermediate and projector lenses when the microscope is
 operated in the diffraction mode.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.electron_source: The source of electrons. The electron gun.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.microscope_model: The name of the model of microscope.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.nominal_cs:
The spherical aberration coefficient (Cs) in millimeters,
 of the objective lens.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.nominal_defocus_max:
The maximum defocus value of the objective lens (in nanometers) used
 to obtain the recorded images. Negative values refer to overfocus.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.nominal_defocus_min:
The minimum defocus value of the objective lens (in nanometers) used
 to obtain the recorded images. Negative values refer to overfocus.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.nominal_magnification: The magnification indicated by the microscope readout.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.recording_temperature_maximum:
The specimen temperature maximum (kelvin) for the duration
 of imaging.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.recording_temperature_minimum:
The specimen temperature minimum (kelvin) for the duration
 of imaging.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.residual_tilt: Residual tilt of the electron beam (in miliradians)
field_descriptions.EmImaging.specimen_holder_model: The name of the model of specimen holder used during imaging.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.specimen_holder_type: The type of specimen holder used during imaging.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.specimen_id: Foreign key to the EM_SPECIMEN category
field_descriptions.EmImaging.temperature:
The mean specimen stage temperature (in kelvin) during imaging
 in the microscope.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.tilt_angle_max:
The maximum angle at which the specimen was tilted to obtain
 recorded images.
field_descriptions.EmImaging.tilt_angle_min:
The minimum angle at which the specimen was tilted to obtain
 recorded images.

field_descriptions.EmParticleSelection.details:
Additional detail such as description of filters used, if selection was
manual or automated, and/or template details.
field_descriptions.EmParticleSelection.image_processing_id:
The value of _em_particle_selection.image_processing_id points to
 the EM_IMAGE_PROCESSING category.
field_descriptions.EmParticleSelection.num_particles_select: The number of particles selected from the projection set of images.

field_descriptions.EmSingleParticleEntity.point_symmetry: Point symmetry symbol, either Cn, Dn, T, O, or I

field_descriptions.EmSoftware.fitting_id: pointer to _em_3d_fitting.id in the EM_3D_FITTING category.
field_descriptions.EmSoftware.image_processing_id: pointer to _em_image_processing.id in the EM_IMAGE_PROCESSING category.
field_descriptions.EmSoftware.imaging_id: pointer to _em_imaging.id in the EM_IMAGING category.
field_descriptions.EmSoftware.name:
The name of the software package used, e.g., RELION.  Depositors are strongly
  encouraged to provide a value in this field.

field_descriptions.EmSpecimen.concentration:
The concentration (in milligrams per milliliter, mg/ml)
 of the complex in the sample.
field_descriptions.EmSpecimen.details: A description of any additional details of the specimen preparation.
field_descriptions.EmSpecimen.embedding_applied: 'YES' indicates that the specimen has been embedded.
field_descriptions.EmSpecimen.shadowing_applied: 'YES' indicates that the specimen has been shadowed.
field_descriptions.EmSpecimen.staining_applied: 'YES' indicates that the specimen has been stained.
field_descriptions.EmSpecimen.vitrification_applied: 'YES' indicates that the specimen was vitrified by cryopreservation.

field_descriptions.EmStaining.details: Staining procedure used in the specimen preparation.
field_descriptions.EmStaining.specimen_id: Foreign key relationship to the EM SPECIMEN category

field_descriptions.EmVitrification.chamber_temperature: The temperature (in kelvin) of the sample just prior to vitrification.
field_descriptions.EmVitrification.cryogen_name: This is the name of the cryogen.
field_descriptions.EmVitrification.details: Any additional details relating to vitrification.
field_descriptions.EmVitrification.humidity:
Relative humidity (%) of air surrounding the specimen just prior to
vitrification.
field_descriptions.EmVitrification.instrument: The type of instrument used in the vitrification process.
field_descriptions.EmVitrification.specimen_id: This data item is a pointer to _em_specimen.id
field_descriptions.EmVitrification.temp:
The vitrification temperature (in kelvin), e.g.,
  temperature of the plunge instrument cryogen bath.
field_descriptions.EmVitrification.time_resolved_state:
The length of time after an event effecting the sample that
 vitrification was induced and a description of the event.

field_descriptions.Entry.id:
The value of _entry.id identifies the data block.

 Note that this item need not be a number; it can be any unique
 identifier.
field_descriptions.Entry.ma_collection_id: An identifier for the model collection associated with the entry.

field_descriptions.Exptl.crystals_number:
The total number of crystals used in the  measurement of
 intensities.
field_descriptions.Exptl.details:
Any special information about the experimental work prior to the
 intensity measurement. See also _exptl_crystal.preparation.
field_descriptions.Exptl.method: The method used in the experiment.
field_descriptions.Exptl.method_details: A description of special aspects of the experimental method.

field_descriptions.ExptlCrystal.density_Matthews:
The density of the crystal, expressed as the ratio of the
 volume of the asymmetric unit to the molecular mass of a
 monomer of the structure, in units of angstroms^3^ per dalton.

 Ref: Matthews, B. W. (1968). J. Mol. Biol. 33, 491-497.
field_descriptions.ExptlCrystal.density_meas:
Density values measured using standard chemical and physical
 methods. The units are megagrams per cubic metre (grams per
 cubic centimetre).
field_descriptions.ExptlCrystal.density_percent_sol:
Density value P calculated from the crystal cell and contents,
 expressed as per cent solvent.

 P = 1 - (1.23 N MMass) / V

 N     = the number of molecules in the unit cell
 MMass = the molecular mass of each molecule (gm/mole)
 V     = the volume of the unit cell (A^3^)
 1.23  = a conversion factor evaluated as:

         (0.74 cm^3^/g) (10^24^ A^3^/cm^3^)
         --------------------------------------
              (6.02*10^23^) molecules/mole

         where 0.74 is an assumed value for the partial specific
         volume of the molecule
field_descriptions.ExptlCrystal.description:
A description of the quality and habit of the crystal.
 The crystal dimensions should not normally be reported here;
 use instead the specific items in the EXPTL_CRYSTAL category
 relating to size for the gross dimensions of the crystal and
 data items in the EXPTL_CRYSTAL_FACE category to describe the
 relationship between individual faces.
field_descriptions.ExptlCrystal.id:
The value of _exptl_crystal.id must uniquely identify a record in
 the EXPTL_CRYSTAL list.

 Note that this item need not be a number; it can be any unique
 identifier.
field_descriptions.ExptlCrystal.pdbx_mosaicity:
Isotropic approximation of the distribution of mis-orientation angles
specified in degrees of all the mosaic domain blocks in the crystal,
represented as a standard deviation. Here, a mosaic block is a set of
contiguous unit cells assumed to be perfectly aligned. Lower mosaicity
indicates better ordered crystals. See for example:

Nave, C. (1998). Acta Cryst. D54, 848-853.

Note that many software packages estimate the mosaic rotation distribution
differently and may combine several physical properties of the experiment
into a single mosaic term. This term will help fit the modeled spots
to the observed spots without necessarily being directly related to the
physics of the crystal itself.
field_descriptions.ExptlCrystal.pdbx_mosaicity_esd: The uncertainty in the mosaicity estimate for the crystal.
field_descriptions.ExptlCrystal.preparation:
Details of crystal growth and preparation of the crystal (e.g.
 mounting) prior to the intensity measurements.

field_descriptions.ExptlCrystalGrow.crystal_id:
This data item is a pointer to _exptl_crystal.id in the
 EXPTL_CRYSTAL category.
field_descriptions.ExptlCrystalGrow.details: A description of special aspects of the crystal growth.
field_descriptions.ExptlCrystalGrow.method: The method used to grow the crystals.
field_descriptions.ExptlCrystalGrow.pH:
The pH at which the crystal was grown. If more than one pH was
 employed during the crystallization process, the final pH should
 be noted here and the protocol involving multiple pH values
 should be described in _exptl_crystal_grow.details.
field_descriptions.ExptlCrystalGrow.pdbx_details: Text description of crystal growth procedure.
field_descriptions.ExptlCrystalGrow.pdbx_pH_range:
The range of pH values at which the crystal was grown.   Used when
 a point estimate of pH is not appropriate.
field_descriptions.ExptlCrystalGrow.temp:
The temperature in kelvins at which the crystal was grown.
 If more than one temperature was employed during the
 crystallization process, the final temperature should be noted
 here and the protocol  involving multiple temperatures should be
 described in _exptl_crystal_grow.details.
field_descriptions.ExptlCrystalGrow.temp_details:
A description of special aspects of temperature control during
 crystal growth.

field_descriptions.IhmEntryCollectionMapping.collection_id:
Identifier for the entry collection. 
 This data item is a pointer to _ihm_entry_collection.id in the 
 IHM_ENTRY_COLLECTION category.

field_descriptions.IhmExternalReferenceInfo.associated_url:
The Uniform Resource Locator (URL) corresponding to the external reference (DOI). 
 This URL should link to the corresponding downloadable file or archive and is provided 
 to enable automated software to download the referenced file or archive.
field_descriptions.IhmExternalReferenceInfo.reference:
The external reference or the Digital Object Identifier (DOI).
 This field is not relevant for local files.
field_descriptions.IhmExternalReferenceInfo.reference_provi: The name of the reference provider.

field_descriptions.MaData.content_type: The type of data held in the dataset.
field_descriptions.MaData.id: A unique identifier for the data.
field_descriptions.MaData.name: An author-given name for the content held in the dataset.

field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionCategory.category: The category updated in the pdbx_audit_revision_category record.
field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionCategory.data_content_t: The type of file that the pdbx_audit_revision_history record refers to.
field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionCategory.ordinal: A unique identifier for the pdbx_audit_revision_category record.

field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionDetails.data_content_ty: The type of file that the pdbx_audit_revision_history record refers to.
field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionDetails.ordinal: A unique identifier for the pdbx_audit_revision_details record.
field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionDetails.type: A type classification of the revision

field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionGroup.data_content_type: The type of file that the pdbx_audit_revision_history record refers to.
field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionGroup.group: The collection of categories updated with this revision.
field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionGroup.ordinal: A unique identifier for the pdbx_audit_revision_group record.

field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionHistory.data_content_ty: The type of file that the pdbx_audit_revision_history record refers to.
field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionHistory.major_revision: The major version number of deposition release.
field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionHistory.minor_revision: The minor version number of deposition release.
field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionHistory.ordinal: A unique identifier for the pdbx_audit_revision_history record.
field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionHistory.revision_date: The release date of the revision

field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionItem.data_content_type: The type of file that the pdbx_audit_revision_history record refers to.
field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionItem.item: A high level explanation the author has provided for submitting a revision.
field_descriptions.PdbxAuditRevisionItem.ordinal: A unique identifier for the pdbx_audit_revision_item record.

field_descriptions.PdbxAuditSupport.country:
The country/region providing the funding support for the entry.
 Funding information is optionally provided for entries after June 2016.
field_descriptions.PdbxAuditSupport.funding_organization:
The name of the organization providing funding support for the
 entry. Funding information is optionally provided for entries
 after June 2016.
field_descriptions.PdbxAuditSupport.grant_number: The grant number associated with this source of support.
field_descriptions.PdbxAuditSupport.ordinal: A unique sequential integer identifier for each source of support for this entry.

field_descriptions.PdbxDatabasePDBObsSpr.details: Details related to the replaced or replacing entry.
field_descriptions.PdbxDatabasePDBObsSpr.id: Identifier for the type of obsolete entry to be added to this entry.
field_descriptions.PdbxDatabasePDBObsSpr.pdb_id: The new PDB identifier for the replaced entry.
field_descriptions.PdbxDatabasePDBObsSpr.replace_pdb_id: The PDB identifier for the replaced (OLD) entry/entries.

field_descriptions.PdbxDatabaseRelated.content_type: The identifying content type of the related entry.
field_descriptions.PdbxDatabaseRelated.db_id: The identifying code in the related database.
field_descriptions.PdbxDatabaseRelated.db_name: The name of the database containing the related entry.
field_descriptions.PdbxDatabaseRelated.details: A description of the related entry.

field_descriptions.PdbxDatabaseStatus.SG_entry:
This code indicates whether the entry belongs to
 Structural Genomics Project.
field_descriptions.PdbxDatabaseStatus.deposit_site: The site where the file was deposited.
field_descriptions.PdbxDatabaseStatus.methods_development_c:
The methods development category in which this
 entry has been placed.
field_descriptions.PdbxDatabaseStatus.pdb_format_compatible:
A flag indicating that the entry is compatible with the PDB format.

 A value of 'N' indicates that the no PDB format data file is
 corresponding to this entry is available in the PDB archive.
field_descriptions.PdbxDatabaseStatus.process_site: The site where the file was deposited.
field_descriptions.PdbxDatabaseStatus.recvd_initial_deposit:
The date of initial deposition.  (The first message for
 deposition has been received.)
field_descriptions.PdbxDatabaseStatus.status_code_cs: Code for status of chemical shift data file.
field_descriptions.PdbxDatabaseStatus.status_code_mr: Code for status of NMR constraints file.
field_descriptions.PdbxDatabaseStatus.status_code_sf: Code for status of structure factor file.

field_descriptions.PdbxDepositGroup.group_description: A description of the contents of entries in the collection.
field_descriptions.PdbxDepositGroup.group_id: A unique identifier for a group of entries deposited as a collection.
field_descriptions.PdbxDepositGroup.group_title: A title to describe the group of entries deposited in the collection.
field_descriptions.PdbxDepositGroup.group_type: Text to describe a grouping of entries in multiple collections

field_descriptions.PdbxInitialRefinementModel.accession_cod:
This item identifies an accession code of the resource where the initial model
 is used
field_descriptions.PdbxInitialRefinementModel.details: A description of special aspects of the initial model
field_descriptions.PdbxInitialRefinementModel.entity_id_lis: A comma separated list of entities reflecting the initial model used for refinement
field_descriptions.PdbxInitialRefinementModel.id: A unique identifier for the starting model record.
field_descriptions.PdbxInitialRefinementModel.source_name: This item identifies the resource of initial model used for refinement
field_descriptions.PdbxInitialRefinementModel.type: This item describes the type of the initial model was generated

field_descriptions.PdbxMoleculeFeatures.class: Broadly defines the function of the molecule.
field_descriptions.PdbxMoleculeFeatures.name: A name of the molecule.
field_descriptions.PdbxMoleculeFeatures.prd_id:
The value of _pdbx_molecule_features.prd_id is the accession code for this
 reference molecule.
field_descriptions.PdbxMoleculeFeatures.type: Defines the structural classification of the molecule.

field_descriptions.PdbxNmrDetails.text: Additional details describing the NMR experiment.

field_descriptions.PdbxNmrEnsemble.average_constraint_viola:
The average number of constraint violations on a per residue basis for
 the ensemble.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrEnsemble.average_constraints_per_: The average number of constraints per residue for the ensemble
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrEnsemble.average_distance_constra: The average distance restraint violation for the ensemble.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrEnsemble.average_torsion_angle_co: The average torsion angle constraint violation for the ensemble.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrEnsemble.conformer_selection_crit:
By highlighting the appropriate choice(s), describe how the submitted
conformer (models) were selected.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrEnsemble.conformers_calculated_to: The total number of conformer (models) that were calculated in the final round.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrEnsemble.conformers_submitted_tot: The number of conformer (models) that are submitted for the ensemble.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrEnsemble.distance_constraint_viol:
Describe the method used to calculate the distance constraint violation statistics,
 i.e. are they calculated over all the distance constraints or calculated for
 violations only?
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrEnsemble.maximum_distance_constra: The maximum distance constraint violation for the ensemble.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrEnsemble.maximum_lower_distance_c: The maximum lower distance constraint violation for the ensemble.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrEnsemble.maximum_torsion_angle_co: The maximum torsion angle constraint violation for the ensemble.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrEnsemble.maximum_upper_distance_c: The maximum upper distance constraint violation for the ensemble.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrEnsemble.representative_conformer: The number of the conformer identified as most representative.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrEnsemble.torsion_angle_constraint:
This item describes the method used to calculate the torsion angle constraint violation statistics.
i.e. are the entered values based on all torsion angle or calculated for violations only?

field_descriptions.PdbxNmrExptl.conditions_id: The number to identify the set of sample conditions.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrExptl.experiment_id: A numerical ID for each experiment.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrExptl.sample_state: Physical state of the sample either anisotropic or isotropic.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrExptl.solution_id:
The solution_id from the Experimental Sample to identify the sample
 that these conditions refer to.

 [Remember to save the entries here before returning to the
  Experimental Sample form]

field_descriptions.PdbxNmrExptlSampleConditions.conditions_: The condition number as defined above.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrExptlSampleConditions.details:
General details describing conditions of both the sample and the environment
during measurements.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrExptlSampleConditions.ionic_stren:
The ionic strength at which the NMR data were collected -in lieu of
 this enter the concentration and identity of the salt in the sample.
Estimate of the standard error for the value for the sample ionic strength.
Units for the value of the sample condition ionic strength..
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrExptlSampleConditions.label: A descriptive label that uniquely identifies this set of sample conditions.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrExptlSampleConditions.pH: The pH at which the NMR data were collected.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrExptlSampleConditions.pH_err: Estimate of the standard error for the value for the sample pH.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrExptlSampleConditions.pH_units: Units for the value of the sample condition pH.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrExptlSampleConditions.pressure: The pressure at which NMR data were collected.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrExptlSampleConditions.pressure_er: Estimate of the standard error for the value for the sample pressure.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrExptlSampleConditions.pressure_un: The units of pressure at which NMR data were collected.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrExptlSampleConditions.temperature:
The temperature (in kelvin) at which NMR data were
 collected.
Estimate of the standard error for the value for the sample temperature.
Units for the value of the sample condition temperature.

field_descriptions.PdbxNmrRefine.details: Additional details about the NMR refinement.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrRefine.method: The method used to determine the structure.

field_descriptions.PdbxNmrRepresentative.conformer_id:
If a member of the ensemble has been selected as a representative
 structure, identify it by its model number.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrRepresentative.selection_criteria:
By highlighting the appropriate choice(s), describe the criteria used to
select this structure as a representative structure, or if an average
structure has been calculated describe how this was done.

field_descriptions.PdbxNmrSampleDetails.contents:
A complete description of each NMR sample. Include the concentration
and concentration units for each component (include buffers, etc.). For each
component describe the isotopic composition, including the % labeling level,
if known.

For example:
1. Uniform (random) labeling with 15N: U-15N
2. Uniform (random) labeling with 13C, 15N at known labeling
   levels: U-95% 13C;U-98% 15N
3. Residue selective labeling: U-95% 15N-Thymine
4. Site specific labeling: 95% 13C-Ala18,
5. Natural abundance labeling in an otherwise uniformly labeled
   biomolecule is designated by NA: U-13C; NA-K,H
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrSampleDetails.details: Brief description of the sample providing additional information not captured by other items in the category.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrSampleDetails.label:
A value that uniquely identifies this sample from the other samples listed
in the entry.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrSampleDetails.solvent_system: The solvent system used for this sample.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrSampleDetails.type:
A descriptive term for the sample that defines the general physical properties
of the sample.

field_descriptions.PdbxNmrSoftware.authors:
The name of the authors of the software used in this
 procedure.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrSoftware.name: The name of the software used for the task.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrSoftware.ordinal: An ordinal index for this category

field_descriptions.PdbxNmrSpectrometer.details: A text description of the NMR spectrometer.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrSpectrometer.field_strength: The field strength in MHz of the spectrometer
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrSpectrometer.manufacturer: The name of the manufacturer of the spectrometer.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrSpectrometer.model: The model of the NMR spectrometer.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrSpectrometer.spectrometer_id: Assign a numerical ID to each instrument.
field_descriptions.PdbxNmrSpectrometer.type:
Select the instrument manufacturer(s) and the model(s) of the NMR(s)
used for this work.

field_descriptions.PdbxReflnsTwin.crystal_id:
The crystal identifier.  A reference to
 _exptl_crystal.id in category EXPTL_CRYSTAL.
field_descriptions.PdbxReflnsTwin.diffrn_id:
The diffraction data set identifier.  A reference to
 _diffrn.id in category DIFFRN.
field_descriptions.PdbxReflnsTwin.domain_id: An identifier for the twin domain.
field_descriptions.PdbxReflnsTwin.fraction:
The twin fraction or twin factor represents a quantitative parameter for the
crystal twinning.  The value 0 represents no twinning, < 0.5 partial twinning,
 = 0.5 for perfect twinning.
field_descriptions.PdbxReflnsTwin.operator:
The possible merohedral or hemihedral twinning operators for different
point groups are:

True point group  	Twin operation  	hkl related to
3                      	2 along a,b             h,-h-k,-l
                       	2 along a*,b*           h+k,-k,-l
                        2 along c               -h,-k,l
4                       2 along a,b,a*,b*       h,-k,-l
6                       2 along a,b,a*,b*       h,-h-k,-l
321                     2 along a*,b*,c         -h,-k,l
312                     2 along a,b,c           -h,-k,l
23                      4 along a,b,c            k,-h,l

References:
 Yeates, T.O. (1997) Methods in Enzymology 276, 344-358. Detecting and
 Overcoming Crystal Twinning.

 and information from the following on-line sites:

   CNS site http://cns.csb.yale.edu/v1.1/
   CCP4 site http://www.ccp4.ac.uk/dist/html/detwin.html
   SHELX site http://shelx.uni-ac.gwdg.de/~rherbst/twin.html
field_descriptions.PdbxReflnsTwin.type:
There are two types of twinning: merohedral or hemihedral
                                 non-merohedral or epitaxial

For merohedral twinning the diffraction patterns from the different domains are
completely superimposable.   Hemihedral twinning is a special case of merohedral
twinning. It only involves two distinct domains.  Pseudo-merohedral twinning is
a subclass merohedral twinning in which lattice is coincidentally superimposable.

In the case of non-merohedral or epitaxial twinning  the reciprocal
lattices do not superimpose exactly. In this case the  diffraction pattern
consists of two (or more) interpenetrating lattices, which can in principle
be separated.

field_descriptions.PdbxRelatedExpDataSet.data_reference: A DOI reference to the related data set.
field_descriptions.PdbxRelatedExpDataSet.data_set_type: The type of the experimenatal data set.
field_descriptions.PdbxRelatedExpDataSet.details:
Additional details describing the content of the related data set and its application to
 the current investigation.
field_descriptions.PdbxRelatedExpDataSet.metadata_reference: A DOI reference to the metadata decribing the related data set.

field_descriptions.PdbxSGProject.full_name_of_center: The value identifies the full name of center.
field_descriptions.PdbxSGProject.id: A unique integer identifier for this center
field_descriptions.PdbxSGProject.initial_of_center: The value identifies the full name of center.
field_descriptions.PdbxSGProject.project_name: The value identifies the Structural Genomics project.

field_descriptions.PdbxSerialCrystallographyDataReduction.c:
For experiments in which samples are provided in a
 continuous stream, the total number of frames collected
 in which the crystal was hit.
field_descriptions.PdbxSerialCrystallographyDataReduction.d:
The data item is a pointer to _diffrn.id in the DIFFRN
 category.

For experiments in which samples are provided in a
 continuous stream, the total number of frames collected
 in which a droplet was hit.
field_descriptions.PdbxSerialCrystallographyDataReduction.f:
For experiments in which samples are provided in a
 continuous stream, the total number of data frames collected
 in which the sample was hit.

For experiments in which samples are provided in a
 continuous stream, the total number of data frames collected
 that contained a "hit" but failed to index.

For experiments in which samples are provided in a
 continuous stream, the total number of data frames collected
 that were indexed.

The total number of data frames collected for this
 data set.
field_descriptions.PdbxSerialCrystallographyDataReduction.l:
For experiments in which samples are provided in a
 continuous stream, the total number of lattices indexed.

For experiments in which samples are provided in a
            continuous stream, the total number of crystal lattices
            that were merged in the final dataset.  Can be
            less than frames_indexed depending on filtering during merging or
	    can be more than frames_indexed if there are multiple lattices.
	    per frame.
field_descriptions.PdbxSerialCrystallographyDataReduction.x: For FEL experiments, the number of pulse events in the dataset.

For FEL experiments, in which data collection was performed
	       in batches, indicates which subset of the data collected
               were used in producing this dataset.

field_descriptions.PdbxSerialCrystallographyMeasurement.col: The total number of hours required to measure this data set.
The collimation or type of focusing optics applied to the radiation.
field_descriptions.PdbxSerialCrystallographyMeasurement.dif:
The data item is a pointer to _diffrn.id in the DIFFRN
 category.
field_descriptions.PdbxSerialCrystallographyMeasurement.foc:
The focal spot size of the beam
 impinging on the sample (micrometres squared).
field_descriptions.PdbxSerialCrystallographyMeasurement.pho: The photons per pulse measured in  (tera photons (10^(12)^)/pulse units).
field_descriptions.PdbxSerialCrystallographyMeasurement.pul:
The average duration (femtoseconds)
	       of the pulse energy measured at the sample.
The energy/pulse of the X-ray pulse impacting the sample measured in microjoules.
The photon energy of the X-ray pulse measured in KeV.
field_descriptions.PdbxSerialCrystallographyMeasurement.sou: The distance from source to the sample along the optical axis (metres).
The dimension of the source beam measured at the source (micrometres squared).
field_descriptions.PdbxSerialCrystallographyMeasurement.xfe: For FEL experiments, the pulse repetition rate measured in cycles per seconds.

The description of the mechanism by which the specimen in placed in the path
 of the source.

The data item is a pointer to _diffrn.id in the DIFFRN
 category.

The description of the mechanism by which the specimen in placed in the path
 of the source.

field_descriptions.PdbxSerialCrystallographySampleDeliveryF: The number of crystals per dropplet or pore in fixed target
For a fixed target sample, a description of sample preparation
Any details pertinent to the fixed sample target

The data item is a pointer to _diffrn.id in the DIFFRN
 category.
Device used to control movement of the fixed sample
Method to prevent dehydration of sample
For a fixed target sample, mechanism to hold sample in the beam
The sample solution content and concentration

Size of pore in grid supporting sample. Diameter or length in micrometres,
 e.g. pore diameter
Type of base holding the support
Velocity of sample horizontally relative to a perpendicular beam in millimetres/second
Velocity of sample vertically relative to a perpendicular beam in millimetres/second

field_descriptions.PdbxSerialCrystallographySampleDeliveryI:
For continuous sample flow experiments, the carrier buffer used
 to move the sample into the beam. Should include protein
 concentration.

For continuous sample flow experiments, the concentration of
 crystals in the solution being injected.

 The concentration is measured in million crystals/ml.

For continuous sample flow experiments, a description of the injector used
 to move the sample into the beam.

The data item is a pointer to _diffrn.id in the DIFFRN
 category.
The size of filter in micrometres in filtering crystals

For continuous sample flow experiments, the flow rate of
 solution being injected  measured in ul/min.

For continuous sample flow experiments, the diameter of the
 injector in micrometres.
The type of nozzle to deliver and focus sample jet

For continuous sample flow experiments, the mean pressure
 in kilopascals at which the sample is injected into the beam.

For continuous sample flow experiments, the temperature in
 Kelvins of the speciman injected. This may be different from
 the temperature of the sample.
Diameter in micrometres of jet stream of sample delivery
Sample deliver driving force, e.g. Gas, Electronic Potential
Details of crystal growth and preparation of the crystals

field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.buffer_name:
The name of the buffer used for the sample in the solution scattering
 experiment.
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.concentration_range:
The concentration range (mg/mL) of the complex in the
 sample used in the solution scattering experiment to
 determine the mean radius of structural elongation.
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.data_analysis_software_l: A list of the software used in the data analysis
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.data_reduction_software_: A list of the software used in the data reduction
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.detector_specific:
The particular radiation detector. In general this will be a
  manufacturer, description, model number or some combination of
  these.
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.detector_type: The general class of the radiation detector.
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.id:
The value of _pdbx_soln_scatter.id must
 uniquely identify the sample in the category PDBX_SOLN_SCATTER
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.max_mean_cross_sectional:
The maximum mean radius of structural elongation of the sample.
 In a given solute-solvent contrast, the radius of gyration
 R_G is a measure of structural elongation if the internal
 inhomogeneity of scattering densities has no effect. Guiner
 analysis at low Q give the R_G and the forward scattering at
 zero angle I(0).

    lnl(Q) = lnl(0) - R_G^2Q^2/3

 where
       Q = 4(pi)sin(theta/lamda)
       2theta = scattering angle
       lamda = wavelength

 The above expression is valid in a QR_G range for extended
 rod-like particles. The relative I(0)/c values ( where
  c = sample concentration) for sample measurements in a
 constant buffer for a single sample data session, gives the
 relative masses of the protein(s) studied when referenced
 against a standard.

 see:
     O.Glatter & O.Kratky, (1982). Editors of "Small angle
      X-ray Scattering, Academic Press, New York.
     O.Kratky. (1963). X-ray small angle scattering with
      substances of biological interest in diluted solutions.
      Prog. Biophys. Chem., 13, 105-173.
     G.D.Wignall & F.S.Bates, (1987). The small-angle approximation
      of X-ray and neutron scatter from rigid rods of non-uniform
      cross section and finite length. J.Appl. Crystallog., 18, 452-460.

 If the structure is elongated, the mean radius of gyration
 of the cross-sectional structure R_XS  and the mean cross sectional
 intensity at zero angle [I(Q).Q]_Q->0 is obtained from
    ln[I(Q).Q] = ln[l(Q).(Q)]_Q->0 - ((R_XS)^2Q^2)/2

minimum mean radius of structural elongation of the sample.

R_G is a measure of structural elongation if the internal
inhomogeneity of scattering densities has no effect. Guiner

rod-like particles. The relative I(0)/c values ( where

constant buffer for a single sample data session, gives the

against a standard.

field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.num_time_frames: The number of time frame solution scattering images used.
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.protein_length:
The length (or range) of the protein sample under study.
If the solution structure is approximated as an elongated elliptical
cyclinder the length L is determined from,

  L = sqrt [12( (R_G)^2  -  (R_XS)^2 ) ]

The length should also be given by

  L = pi I(0) / [ I(Q).Q]_Q->0
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.sample_pH: The pH value of the buffered sample.
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.source_beamline: The beamline name used for the experiment
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.source_beamline_instrume: The instrumentation used on the beamline
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.source_class: The general class of the radiation source.
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.source_type: The make, model, name or beamline of the source of radiation.
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.temperature:
The temperature in kelvins at which the experiment
 was conducted
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatter.type: The type of solution scattering experiment carried out

field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatterModel.conformer_selection:
A description of the conformer selection criteria
 used.
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatterModel.details: A description of any additional details concerning the experiment.
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatterModel.entry_fitting_list:
A list of the entries used to fit the model
 to the scattering data
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatterModel.id:
The value of _pdbx_soln_scatter_model.id must
 uniquely identify the sample in the category PDBX_SOLN_SCATTER_MODEL
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatterModel.method: A description of the methods used in the modelling
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatterModel.num_conformers_calc: The number of model conformers calculated.
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatterModel.num_conformers_subm: The number of model conformers submitted in the entry
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatterModel.representative_conf: The index of the representative conformer among the submitted conformers for the entry
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatterModel.scatter_id: This data item is a pointer to  _pdbx_soln_scatter.id in the  PDBX_SOLN_SCATTER category.
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatterModel.software_author_lis: A list of the software authors
field_descriptions.PdbxSolnScatterModel.software_list: A list of the software used in the modeeling

field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummary.RNA_suiteness:
The MolProbity conformer-match quality parameter for RNA structures.
Low values are worse. Specific to structures that contain RNA polymers.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummary.attempted_validation_ste:
The steps that were attempted by the validation pipeline software. 
A step typically involves running a 3rd party validation tool, for instance "mogul"
Each step will be enumerated in _pdbx_vrpt_software category.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummary.ligands_for_buster_repor: A flag indicating if there are ligands in the model used for detailed Buster analysis.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummary.report_creation_date:
The date, time and time-zone that the validation report  was created. 
The string will be formatted like yyyy-mm-dd:hh:mm in GMT time.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummary.restypes_notchecked_for_:
This is a comma separated list of the residue types whose bond lengths and bond angles have 
not been checked against "standard geometry" using the MolProbity dangle program.
Standard geometry parameters are taken from Engh and Huber (2001) and Parkinson et al. (1996)

field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.B_factor_type: An indicator if isotropic B factors are partial or full values.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.Babinet_b:
REFMAC scaling parameter as reported in log output line starting 'bulk solvent: scale'.
X-ray entry specific, obtained in the EDS step from REFMAC calculation.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.Babinet_k:
REFMAC scaling parameter as reported in log output line starting 'bulk solvent: scale'.
X-ray entry specific, obtained in the EDS step from REFMAC calculation.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.CCP4_version: The version of CCP4 suite used in the analysis.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.DCC_R:
The overall R-factor from a DCC recalculation of an electron density map.
Currently value is rounded to 2 decimal places.
X-ray entry specific, obtained from the DCC program.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.EDS_R:
The overall R factor from the EDS REFMAC calculation (no free set is used in this).
Currently value is rounded to 2 decimal places.
X-ray entry specific, obtained in the eds step from REFMAC calculation.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.EDS_R_warning: Warning message when EDS calculated R vs reported R is higher than a threshold
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.EDS_res_high:
The data high resolution diffraction limit, in Angstroms, found in the input structure factor file.
X-ray entry specific, obtained in the EDS step.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.EDS_res_low:
The data low resolution diffraction limit, in Angstroms, found in the input structure factor file.
X-ray entry specific, obtained in the EDS step.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.Fo_Fc_correla:
Fo,Fc correlation: The difference between the observed structure factors (Fo) and the 
calculated structure factors (Fc) measures the correlation between the model and the
experimental data. 
X-ray entry specific, obtained in the eds step from REFMAC calculation.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.I_over_sigma:
Each reflection has an intensity (I) and an uncertainty in measurement 
(sigma(I)), so I/sigma(I) is the signal-to-noise ratio. This
ratio decreases at higher resolution. <I/sigma(I)> is the mean of individual I/sigma(I)
values. Value for outer resolution shell is given in parentheses. In case
structure factor amplitudes are deposited, Xtriage estimates the intensities
first and then calculates this metric. When intensities are available in the
deposited file, these are converted to amplitudes and then back to intensity
estimate before calculating the metric.  
X-ray entry specific, calculated by Phenix Xtriage program.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.Padilla_Yeate:
Padilla and Yeates twinning parameter <|L**2|>.
Theoretical values is 0.333 in the untwinned case, and 0.2 in the perfectly twinned case.
X-ray entry specific, obtained from the Xtriage program.

Padilla and Yeates twinning parameter <|L|>.
Theoretical values is 0.5 in the untwinned case, and 0.375 in the perfectly twinned case.
X-ray entry specific, obtained from the Xtriage program.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.Q_score:
The overall Q-score of the fit of coordinates to the electron map.
The Q-score is defined in Pintilie, GH. et al., Nature Methods, 17, 328-334 (2020)
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.Wilson_B_anis:
Result of absolute likelihood based Wilson scaling, 
The anisotropic B value of the data is determined using a likelihood based approach. 
The resulting B tensor is reported, the 3 diagonal values are given first, followed
by the 3 off diagonal values.
A large spread in (especially the diagonal) values indicates anisotropy. 
X-ray entry specific, calculated by Phenix Xtriage program.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.Wilson_B_esti:
An estimate of the overall B-value of the structure, calculated from the diffraction data. 
Units Angstroms squared.
It serves as an indicator of the degree of order in the crystal and the value is usually 
not hugely different from the average B-value calculated from the model.
X-ray entry specific, calculated by Phenix Xtriage program.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.acentric_outl:
The number of acentric reflections that Xtriage identifies as outliers on the basis 
of Wilson statistics. Note that if pseudo translational symmetry is present, 
a large number of 'outliers' will be present.
X-ray entry specific, calculated by Phenix Xtriage program.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.bulk_solvent_:
REFMAC scaling parameter as reported in log output file.
X-ray entry specific, obtained in the EDS step from REFMAC calculation.

REFMAC reported scaling parameter.
X-ray entry specific, obtained in the EDS step from REFMAC calculation.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.centric_outli:
The number of centric reflections that Xtriage identifies as outliers.
X-ray entry specific, calculated by Phenix Xtriage program.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.data_anisotro:
The ratio (Bmax - Bmin) / Bmean where Bmax, Bmin and Bmean are computed from the B-values 
associated with the principal axes of the anisotropic thermal ellipsoid. 
This ratio is usually less than 0.5; for only 1% of PDB entries it is more than 1.0 (Read et al., 2011).
X-ray entry specific, obtained from the Xtriage program.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.data_complete: The percent completeness of diffraction data.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.density_fitne: The version of density-fitness suite programs used in the analysis.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.num_miller_in:
The number of Miller Indices reported by the Xtriage program. This should be the same as the
number of _refln in the input structure factor file.
X-ray entry specific, calculated by Phenix Xtriage program.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.number_reflns:
The number of reflections in the free set as defined in the input structure factor file supplied to the validation pipeline. 
X-ray entry specific, obtained from the DCC program.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.percent_free_: A percentage, Normally percent proportion of the total number. Between 0% and 100%.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.servalcat_ver: The version of Servalcat program used in the analysis.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.trans_NCS_det:
A sentence giving the result of Xtriage's analysis on translational NCS.
X-ray entry specific, obtained from the Xtriage program.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryDiffraction.twin_fraction:
Estimated twinning fraction for operators as identified by Xtriage. A semicolon separated
list of operators with fractions is givens 
X-ray entry specific, obtained from the Xtriage program.

field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryEm.Q_score:
The overall Q-score of the fit of coordinates to the electron map.
The Q-score is defined in Pintilie, GH. et al., Nature Methods, 17, 328-334 (2020)
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryEm.atom_inclusion_all_ato: The proportion of all non hydrogen atoms within density.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryEm.atom_inclusion_backbon: The proportion of backbone atoms within density.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryEm.author_provided_fsc_re: The resolution from the intersection of the author provided fsc and the indicator curve halfbit.
The resolution from the intersection of the author provided fsc and the indicator curve onebit.
The resolution from the intersection of the author provided fsc and the indicator curve 0.143.
The resolution from the intersection of the author provided fsc and the indicator curve 0.333.
The resolution from the intersection of the author provided fsc and the indicator curve 0.5.
The resolution from the intersection of the author provided fsc and the indicator curve threesigma.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryEm.calculated_fsc_resolut: The resolution from the intersection of the fsc curve generated by from the provided halfmaps and the indicator curve halfbit.
The resolution from the intersection of the fsc curve generated by from the provided halfmaps and the indicator curve onebit.
The resolution from the intersection of the fsc curve generated by from the provided halfmaps and the indicator curve 0.143.
The resolution from the intersection of the fsc curve generated by from the provided halfmaps and the indicator curve 0.333.
The resolution from the intersection of the fsc curve generated by from the provided halfmaps and the indicator curve 0.5.
The resolution from the intersection of the fsc curve generated by from the provided halfmaps and the indicator curve threesigma.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryEm.contour_level_primary_: The recommended contour level for the primary map of this deposition.

field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryGeometry.angles_RMSZ:
The overall root mean square of the Z-score for deviations of bond angles in comparison to 
"standard geometry" made using the MolProbity dangle program.
Standard geometry parameters are taken from Engh and Huber (2001) and Parkinson et al. (1996).
This value is for all chains in the structure.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryGeometry.bonds_RMSZ:
The overall root mean square of the Z-score for deviations of bond lengths in comparison to 
"standard geometry" made using the MolProbity dangle program.
Standard geometry parameters are taken from Engh and Huber (2001) and Parkinson et al. (1996).
This value is for all chains in the structure.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryGeometry.clashscore:
This score is derived from the number of pairs of atoms in the PDB_model_num that are unusually close to each other. 
It is calculated by the MolProbity pdbx_vrpt_software and expressed as the number or such clashes per thousand atoms.
For structures determined by NMR the clashscore value here will only consider label_atom_id pairs in the 
well-defined (core) residues from ensemble analysis.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryGeometry.clashscore_full_: Only given for structures determined by NMR. The MolProbity pdbx_vrpt_instance_clashes score for all label_atom_id pairs.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryGeometry.num_H_reduce:
This is the number of hydrogen atoms added and optimized by the MolProbity reduce pdbx_vrpt_software as part of the
all-atom clashscore.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryGeometry.num_angles_RMSZ:
The number of bond angles compared to "standard geometry" made using the MolProbity dangle program.
Standard geometry parameters are taken from Engh and Huber (2001) and Parkinson et al. (1996).
This value is for all chains in the structure.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryGeometry.num_bonds_RMSZ:
The number of bond lengths compared to "standard geometry" made using the MolProbity dangle program.
Standard geometry parameters are taken from Engh and Huber (2001) and Parkinson et al. (1996).
This value is for all chains in the structure.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryGeometry.percent_ramachan: The percentage of residues with Ramachandran outliers.

Only given for structures determined by NMR. The MolProbity Ramachandran outlier score
for all atoms in the structure rather than just the well-defined (core) residues.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryGeometry.percent_rotamer_:
The MolProbity sidechain outlier score (a percentage).
Protein sidechains mostly adopt certain (combinations of) preferred torsion angle values 
(called rotamers or rotameric conformers), much like their backbone torsion angles 
(as assessed in the Ramachandran analysis). MolProbity considers the sidechain conformation 
of a residue to be an outlier if its set of torsion angles is not similar to any preferred 
combination. The sidechain outlier score is calculated as the percentage of residues 
with an unusual sidechain conformation with respect to the total number of residues for 
which the assessment is available.
Example: percent-rota-outliers="2.44".
Specific to structure that contain protein chains and have sidechains modelled.
For NMR structures only the  well-defined (core) residues from ensemble analysis will be considered.
The percentage of residues with rotamer outliers.

Only given for structures determined by NMR. The MolProbity sidechain outlier score
for all atoms in the structure rather than just the well-defined (core) residues.

field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryNmr.chemical_shift_comple:
Overall completeness of the chemical shift assignments for the well-defined 
regions of the structure.

Overall completeness of the chemical shift assignments for the full 
macromolecule or complex as suggested by the molecular description of an entry
(whether some portion of it is modelled or not).
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryNmr.cyrange_error:
Diagnostic message from the wrapper of Cyrange software which identifies the 
well-defined cores (domains) of NMR protein structures.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryNmr.cyrange_number_of_dom: Total number of well-defined cores (domains) identified by Cyrange
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryNmr.medoid_model:
For each Cyrange well-defined core ("cyrange_domain") the id of the PDB_model_num which is most 
similar to other models as measured by pairwise RMSDs over the domain. 
For the whole entry ("Entry"), the medoid PDB_model_num of the largest core is taken as an overall
representative of the structure.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryNmr.nmr_models_consistenc:
A flag indicating if all models in the NMR ensemble contain the exact 
same atoms ("True") or if the models differ in this respect ("False").
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryNmr.nmrclust_error: Diagnostic message from the wrapper of NMRClust software which clusters NMR models.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryNmr.nmrclust_number_of_cl: Total number of clusters in the NMR ensemble identified by NMRClust.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryNmr.nmrclust_number_of_mo:
Number of models analysed by NMRClust - should in almost all cases be the
same as the number of models in the NMR ensemble.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryNmr.nmrclust_number_of_ou: Number of models that do not belong to any cluster as deemed by NMRClust.
field_descriptions.PdbxVrptSummaryNmr.nmrclust_representati: Overall representative PDB_model_num of the NMR ensemble as identified by NMRClust.

field_descriptions.RcsbAccessionInfo.minor_revision: The latest entry minor revision number.

field_descriptions.RcsbBindingAffinity.link: Link to external resource referencing the data.
field_descriptions.RcsbBindingAffinity.provenance_code: The resource name for the related binding affinity reference.
field_descriptions.RcsbBindingAffinity.reference_sequence_i: Data point provided by BindingDB. Percent identity between PDB sequence and reference sequence.
field_descriptions.RcsbBindingAffinity.symbol: Binding affinity symbol indicating approximate or precise strength of the binding.
field_descriptions.RcsbBindingAffinity.type: Binding affinity measurement given in one of the following types:  The concentration constants: IC50: the concentration of ligand that reduces enzyme activity by 50%;  EC50: the concentration of compound that generates a half-maximal response;  The binding constant:  Kd: dissociation constant;  Ka: association constant;  Ki: enzyme inhibition constant;  The thermodynamic parameters:  delta G: Gibbs free energy of binding (for association reaction);  delta H: change in enthalpy associated with a chemical reaction;  delta S: change in entropy associated with a chemical reaction.
field_descriptions.RcsbBindingAffinity.unit: Binding affinity unit.  Dissociation constant Kd is normally in molar units (or millimolar , micromolar, nanomolar, etc).  Association constant Ka is normally expressed in inverse molar units (e.g. M-1).
field_descriptions.RcsbBindingAffinity.value: Binding affinity value between a ligand and its target molecule.

field_descriptions.RcsbEntryInfo.resolution_combined:
Combined estimates of experimental resolution contributing to the refined structural model.
 Resolution reported in "refine.ls_d_res_high" is used for X-RAY DIFFRACTION, FIBER DIFFRACTION, 
 POWDER DIFFRACTION, ELECTRON CRYSTALLOGRAPHY, and NEUTRON DIFFRACTION as identified in
 "refine.pdbx_refine_id". 
 Resolution reported in "em_3d_reconstruction.resolution" is used for ELECTRON MICROSCOPY. 
 The best value corresponding to "em_3d_reconstruction.resolution_method" == "FSC 0.143 CUT-OFF" 
 is used, if available. If not, the best "em_3d_reconstruction.resolution" value is used. 
 For structures that are not obtained from diffraction-based methods, the resolution values in 
 "refine.ls_d_res_high" are ignored.
 Multiple values are reported only if multiple methods are used in the structure determination.

 Priority values for "experimental" structures is currently set to 10 and
 the values for "computational" structures is set to 100.

field_descriptions.RcsbPrimaryCitation.journal_volume:
Volume number of the journal cited; relevant for journal

field_descriptions.RcsbPrimaryCitation.language: Language in which the cited article is written.

field_descriptions.RcsbPrimaryCitation.year:
